name: Fatty Acid Composition of Novel Host Jack Pine Do Not Prevent Host Acceptance and Colonization by the Invasive Mountain Pine Beetle and Its Symbiotic Fungus
description: We evaluated if composition of fatty acids impede or facilitate colonization of jack pine (Pinus banksiana) by the invasive mountain pine beetle (Dendroctonus ponderosae) and its symbiotic fungus (Grosmannia clavigera).

citation.text: Fatty Acid Composition of Novel Host Jack Pine Do Not Prevent Host Acceptance and Colonization by the Invasive Mountain Pine Beetle and Its Symbiotic Fungus

distribution.name: Ishangulyyeva etal_Fungal Growth Data.csv
distribution.description: Effects of various fatty acids on growth of Grosmannia clavigera. For variable descriptions "Ishangulyyeva et al Read Me.txt"

distribution.name: Ishangulyyeva etal_Mountain pine beetle larval growth.csv
distribution.description: Larval growth responses to individual fatty acids. For variable descriptions "Ishangulyyeva et al Read Me.txt"

distribution.name: Ishangulyyeva etal_Phloem Fatty Acid Composition.csv
distribution.description: Fatty acid composition of various tree species. For variable descriptions "Ishangulyyeva et al Read Me.txt:
